content.description:
Four-fifths of this route is a fun "stairway" of positive footholds around 5.5 - 5.7 difficulty. But the middle "flight" is missing some positive steps -- simultaneous with non-positive hand-holds.

Route: Follow the bolts going diagonal Left-ward the whole way.

. (If some of the non-Lead climbers in the party were hoping to find interesting climbing only at difficulty 5.7 or less, just haul or aid them through the much harder crux section quickly, so they can enjoy the rest).

Variation: There is an unprotected crack (difficulty in the 5.11 range?) between the start of Staircase and the start of the bolt-protected corner crack to its left. Could be top-roped from the Staircase top anchor bolts, with a directional on one of middle bolts of the Staircase route.
content.protection:
7 bolts to two-bolt anchor (with a single small rappel ring as of 2016).

Note that this whole route is less than vertical, so any place a leader falls, they might hit something -- and if they hit something they might get hurt.

Note especially that there is a significant ledge close underneath the crux sequence.
content.location: Under a large left-facing corner that trends left up the wall. The right-most bolted line in the Dem Bones area. About 15-20 feet right from the obvious corner crack bolt-protected with a white rectangle name (unreadable as of 2016) below it.

content.description: Follow a black arete on the right or climb the face directly. (stick clip?)  Big powerful moves takes you up the gently overhanging wall.

Climb the slabby rail/ramp thing past the 1st and 2nd bolt. Much harder than it looks. Continue up the tenuous corner where jamming skills and high feet will help. Stem through the roof and don't miss the clutch 2 finger pocket. Rest up before the tenuous finish.
content.location: Underneath the right hand roof at Dem Bones

content.description: Climb easily up into a deep dihedral clipping the first bolt on the way. Climb past the 2nd bolts out onto the arete right of the dihedral and clip the 3rd bolt. Pull through the 3-move (or so) crux to a standing position under the roof and clip the 4th bolt. Step left around the corner and go up a crack for a few moves to the final bolt. Then move out right though a few jugs and make a few final moves up to the anchors on small holds with good footholds. It's probably around 5.10a without the crux at bolt #3. The crux moves are fun and on good rock; a kneebar really makes it much easier.
content.location: Between Goat and Dumb Bone Head on the Dem Bones Wall. Look for a triangular roof about 35 feet up. Hickory Stick (12a) goes up the right side of the roof and Goat goes up the left side.

content.description: Start up a slab to a thin finger crack.  Figure the crux jamming sequence to a pumpy middle section.  A fall at the crux could land you on the ledge.
